message.content:
cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.GR 

The paper discusses the development of a digital atlas methodology that combines information about the 3D organization of the brain and the detailed texture of neurons in different structures. This involves the use of computer vision techniques such as texture detection and alignment of histological stacks to the atlas. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also involves the use of machine learning techniques to automatically align the histological stack to the atlas, which suggests the sub-categories cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) and cs.LG (Machine Learning) as likely options. Additionally, the paper involves the development of an active atlas that can be used to reduce the work of the neuroanatomist, which suggests the sub-categories cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.GR (Graphics) as possible options.
